data.author: Pragya Swastik
data.content: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh has sold an apartment in Mumbai for ₹17.58 crore, Moneycontrol reported citing documents accessed by Zapkey.com. The buyer is JBC International LLP and the sale deed was registered on November 18, 2021. The apartment is spread across a carpet area of 2,830 sq ft and is located on the ninth floor of Rustomjee Elements in Andheri West.
data.title: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh sells apartment in Mumbai for ₹17.58 crore

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Wicketkeeper-batter KL Rahul has been ruled out of the two-match Test series against New Zealand due to a muscle strain on his left thigh. The All-India Senior Selection Committee has named Suryakumar Yadav as KL Rahul's replacement. The first Test between India and New Zealand will begin on November 25, 2021 in Kanpur.
data.title: KL Rahul ruled out of Test series against New Zealand, Suryakumar named replacement

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: After reports claimed India players have been banned from eating pork and beef, BCCI Treasurer Arun Dhumal said, "This plan was never discussed and won't be enforced." He added, "I don’t know when this decision was taken or if it was." "As far as food habits are concerned...it's individual choice of players, BCCI has no role in it," Dhumal stated.
data.title: We don't advise Team India players what to eat: BCCI on reports of no beef, pork in diet

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Ajinkya Rahane, who will lead India in the first Test against New Zealand starting tomorrow, has confirmed that Shreyas Iyer will make his Test debut. Shreyas has played 54 first-class matches, in which he has scored 4,592 runs at an average of 52.18. Shreyas, who has played 22 ODIs and 32 T20Is for India, will become India's 303rd Test player.
data.title: Shreyas Iyer to make his Test debut tomorrow vs New Zealand, confirms Ajinkya Rahane

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: India's T20I captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who represents Melbourne Renegades in Big Bash League, has been named the Player of Women's Big Bash League 2021. Kaur polled 31 votes to finish ahead of Perth Scorchers opening batters Beth Mooney and Sophie Devine, who polled 28 votes apiece. Harmanpreet has scored 399 runs and taken 15 wickets in the season so far.
data.title: Harmanpreet Kaur named Player of Women's Big Bash League 2021

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: World number one women's tennis player Ash Barty got engaged to her longtime boyfriend Garry Kissick. The 25-year-old took to Instagram to share a picture of herself with Kissick and wrote, "Future husband." Kissick also shared pictures and wrote, "15/11/2021... I love you, Ash." Kissick is a trainee golf professional at the Brookwater Golf and Country Club in Australia's Queensland.
data.title: World no. 1 women's tennis player Barty gets engaged to longtime boyfriend, shares pic

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Bangladesh Cricket Board morphed debutant Shohidul Islam's head on Shakib Al Hasan's body in a social media post after he took a wicket in the third T20I against Pakistan. "Shocking that a cricket board's social media page could make such a post," Bangladeshi cricket journalist Mohammad Isam wrote. "This is insulting to both Shakib and Shohidul," wrote another.
data.title: BCB morph debutant Shohidul's head on Shakib's body in social media post, trolled

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: Team India fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar and his wife Nupur Nagar have been blessed with a baby girl. Nupur delivered the baby in Delhi. Bhuvneshwar, who is currently away from his family, reportedly received the news on phone and is expected to reach his residence in Meerut by Thursday. Bhuvneshwar and Nupur tied the knot on November 23, 2017.
data.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar, wife Nupur Nagar blessed with a baby girl

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: Talking about his on-field competition with Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi called it a "beautiful memory" in football history. "It was a very beautiful stage for us...also for the people because they enjoyed it," Paris Saint-Germain forward said. The duo faced each other several times when they played in La Liga. Ronaldo played for Real Madrid, whereas Messi played for Barcelona.
data.title: It is a beautiful memory: Messi on his on-field rivalry with Ronaldo

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: India's two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu will be contesting the BWF Athletes' Commission election to be held during the World Championships in Spain on December 17. Reigning world champion Sindhu is one of the nine candidates nominated for the available six positions. Sindhu is the only current Athletes' Commission member standing for re-election. She was first elected in 2017.
data.title: Sindhu to contest BWF Athletes' Commission election in December

data.author: Veer Badani
data.content: Newly acquired by the Los Angeles Rams, wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr said his salary will be paid in bitcoin, making him the latest National Football League (NFL) player to be paid in cryptocurrency. "It's a NEW ERA & to kick that off I'm hyped to announce that I'm taking my new salary in bitcoin thanks to CashApp," he tweeted.
data.title: American football player Odell Beckham Jr to be paid salary in bitcoin

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara called Ajinkya Rahane a "great player" and said that he is just one "big score" away from bouncing back in form. "Rahane is in good touch...hoping that he will score big runs in this series," Pujara said. Rahane has scored 372 Test runs in 11 matches at an average of 19.57 in 2021 so far.
data.title: Hoping Ajinkya Rahane will score big runs in NZ Test series: Pujara

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: Bangladesh batter Tamim Iqbal has been ruled out of the New Zealand tour due to an injury on his left thumb, which he sustained in October. Bangladesh Cricket Board chief physician Debashish Chowdhury said Tamim has been advised a month's rest after getting injured. "He received a blow on his left thumb and got a small fracture there," Chowdhury said.
data.title: Bangladesh's Tamim Iqbal ruled out of NZ tour due to thumb injury

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Following Manchester United's four defeats in their last five Premier League matches, Argentina and Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) striker Lionel Messi said, "After December, a lot changes and anything can happen." He added, "The Premier League is a very difficult competition and an equal one...things can turn around many times." United are currently eighth in the standings.
data.title: After December, a lot changes and anything can happen: Messi to Man Utd

data.author: Veer Badani
data.content: Kenya's Peres Jepchirchir created history by becoming the first Olympic reigning champion to win the New York City marathon in the same year. "It was not expected. Unbelievable," said the 28-year-old Jepchirchir after finishing the 42.16 km course, five seconds ahead of Kenya's Viola Cheptoo (2:22:44) and Ethiopia's Ababel Yeshaneh (2:22:52).
data.title: Peres Jepchirchir wins New York City marathon with a time of 2:22:39

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: After registering a 3-0 whitewash in the T20I series against Bangladesh, Pakistan skipper Babar Azam said his side is "on the right track". "We'll look to carry the same momentum in Test matches as well," Azam said. Pakistan defeated Bangladesh by five wickets in the third T20I. Both teams will head into two-match Test series that begins on November 26.
data.title: On the right track: Pak captain Babar after T20I series win vs Bangladesh

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: CSK batter Robin Uthappa has said Rishabh Pant deserves a bit of a break to switch off from cricket following the India wicketkeeper-batter's batting performance in team's 3-0 T20I series win against New Zealand. He added that maybe Pant is having a lack of clarity or mental fatigue. Pant scored a total of 33 runs in recently concluded T20I series.
data.title: Pant deserves a bit of a break to switch off from cricket: Uthappa

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Indian shuttler Parupalli Kashyap lost in the first round of men's singles at Indonesia Open. Loh Kean Yew of Singapore defeated Kashyap 21-11, 21-14 on Tuesday. Kashyap lost the match in 32 minutes. In men's doubles, Indian pair of MR Arjun and Dhruv Kapila lost to Choi Sol Gyu and Kim Won Ho 20-22, 13-21 in the first round.
data.title: Parupalli Kashyap loses in 1st round of Indonesia Open

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: Paris Saint-Germain forward Lionel Messi has said his former club Barcelona "will grow" under manager Xavi Hernandez. "Xavi is a coach who knows a lot...who knows everything well since he was a child. He is a very important person for the young people," he said. Messi is Barcelona's all-time top scorer with 672 goals and has played under Xavi's captaincy.
data.title: Xavi is a coach who knows a lot, Barça will grow under him: Messi

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Ex-India bowling coach Bharat Arun said that during Ravi Shastri's tenure as Team India head coach there was "absolutely" no agenda. "The decisions might have been right or wrong, that is irrelevant, but they came from the right place, purely thinking about team values...honesty encompasses criticism, self-introspection," he stated. Shastri was appointed as head coach in July 2017.
data.title: During Shastri's tenure, there was no agenda: Ex-India bowling coach Arun

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Ahead of Hockey Men's Junior World Cup 2021, Indian men's hockey team captain Manpreet Singh said he told junior side's skipper Vivek Sagar Prasad to stay "focussed as a team and don't point fingers" when they lose. Defending champions India will open their campaign against France at Kalinga Stadium, Bhubaneswar on Wednesday. "They [India] can win the trophy," he added.
data.title: Don't point fingers when you lose: Manpreet to Indian men's junior WC side

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Shahrukh Khan, who hit a last ball six in Tamil Nadu's four-wicket win against Karnataka in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final, said MS Dhoni gave him a clear picture of the finisher's role. "Dhoni asked me to believe whatever you're doing on that particular day is right," he added. Shahrukh hit a six when five were needed off last ball.
data.title: Dhoni gave me a clear picture of the finisher's role: TN's Shahrukh

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen exited the Indonesia Open after losing to world number one Kento Momota in the first round. Lakshya lost 21-23, 15-21 to top seed Momota in 53 minutes on Tuesday. Notably, Lakshya had lost to Momota in the second round of Indonesia Masters last week, where the two-time world champion won the title on Sunday.
data.title: Lakshya loses to world no. 1 Momota in Indonesia Open first round

data.author: Veer Badani
data.content: The International Cricket Council (ICC) has said that while India's participation in the 2025 Champions Trophy, set to be held in Pakistan, is a "challenging issue", they remain confident that all teams will participate. "We wouldn't have awarded the event if we didn't think Pakistan was capable of hosting it," said ICC Chairman Greg Barclay.
data.title: Confident all teams will travel to Pakistan for 2025 Champions Trophy: ICC

data.author: Anant Kaur
data.content: Ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi said that Bangladesh need to do "some soul searching" after Pakistan registered a 3-0 T20I series whitewash against them in Dhaka. "Do Bangladesh want to win on such pitches and give ordinary performances abroad and in World Cups? They have great talent...but desperately need better pitches if they want to progress," he added.
data.title: Bangladesh need to do some soul searching: Afridi after Pak's series win
